Experience: ["Our client, an international force within the Real Estate Management space, is seeking an experienced Contract Brand and Content Marketing Manager to help develop integrated strategies and plans that drive brand awareness and revenue.This is a dynamic role within a growing team, reporting directly to the Vice President of Marketing and Business Development. Our client is located downtown and looking for someone to join them for a 3 month long contract starting immediately!In the short term, below are the important projects you will be leading:Continue execution of expanded brand system launched in July. This includes managing an audit of all existing branded materials and creating & executing a plan for updating critical piecesRunning point with an outside agency & internal stakeholders (alongside an internal project manager) with regards to their website redesign projectThis requires a lot of organization, attention to detail, consensus building, communication & pushing things forwardAct as marketing lead on the team that's transitioning the industry publication (JPM) to an online experience. This needs to coordinate with the website redesignOverseeing our overall media plan across all paid channels. Does not require a high-level media buying knowledge - they deal with small industry publications and the usual social channels. Basic knowledge of media metrics & campaign optimizationTake ownership of some select integrated marketing plans - working with stakeholders to understand briefs, creating & executing plans. From a day-to-day perspective, this person will also manage the Content Marketing Manager, so a working knowledge of content strategy, creation & execution is important.Requirements:Bachelor's degree5-8 years of digital marketing experienceExperience managing an outside agencyExperience in B2B and/or Association marketing a plusKnowledge of MS Office, Adobe creative suite, Google analyticsFamiliarity with project management software, CRM/association management software, and marketing automation systems a plusManage a large number of priorities & projects happening at onceCollaborate with, and manage up to, several cross-department stakeholdersAbility to move quickly and get consensusTake charge personality, but keep cool and roll with the changesConfidence to take ownership  Any senior level candidate with initiative, energy, and a great attitude would be well suited for this exciting position. If you are interested in this Contract Brand and Content Marketing Manager position, please apply today!Thank you,Meagan Koepp Senior Project Manager, Marketing Recruiting  LaSalle NetworkKeywords and Related Terms: marketing , marketing director , senior marketing manager , real estate , association , nonprofit , integrated marketing , digital , strategy , b2bLaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer, m/f/d/v.LaSalle Network is the leading provider of professional staffing and recruiting services. LaSalle has worked with more than 10,000 companies, ranging from Fortune 500s to start ups. With units specializing in administrative, accounting and finance, marketing, executive search, technology, supply chain, healthcare revenue cycle, call center, and human resources, LaSalle serves companies of all sizes and across all industries."]

["Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for exceptional new team members that will take us to the next level. One team, one score.We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. If you’re passionate, practice radical transparency to build trust and respect, and thrive when you’re collaborating, experimenting and learning – this may be your ideal work environment.Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer.We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles .Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!Auth0 is seeking a Customer Marketing Manager to help drive existing customers to expand their adoption of Auth0's Identity Platform through effective cross-sell and upsell programs.ResponsibilitiesPartner with sales to attain annual renewal and expansion goalsLead the strategy and execution of cross-sell and upsell programs for our portfolio of customers from start to finish. Responsible/accountable for supporting all the strategic and tactical marketing needed for Auth0’s customersAccountable for Quarterly customer pipeline goals - generated through expansion campaignsResearch and map the Auth0 customer journeyTurn data-driven customer insights into tests and programsMap, align, and monitor programs across all customer touch points to drive the best customer experienceCreate acquisition programs to expand customer contactsDevelop and execute marketing activities to support the overall customer marketing programs including: webinars, direct mails, meetings, newsletters, emails, and customer events Work collaboratively between sales, customer success, marketing, product marketing, design and other teamsLead and execute all Auth0 broad, revenue generating communications for customers. This position would require up to 20% of their time traveling. Qualifications4+ years of experience in a B2B marketing or customer marketing role; technology or software/SaaS industry is preferred.1-2 years success in a customer marketing specific roleAbility to lead and execute effective cross-channel programs (digital, events, direct mail, email, webinars, etc.). Analytical and strategic problem solving skills with a focus on tactical, practical execution and driving results.Passion for driving customer engagement. Attention to detail. Analytical: driven to make decisions from data.Ability to work with remote team members. Experience with Salesforce.com, Google Apps, Slack and video conference tools a plusPreferred Locations: US based remote Role or Bellevue WA#CA; #US;"]

["Role:  The Vital Proteins family is looking to welcome a driven & passionate Marketing Manager, Innovation to join our team. As a key position in our business, this role requires someone who can be the voice of our consumers while delivering innovation propositions. A successful Marketing Manager, Innovation would possess strong strategic thinking, creativity, flexibility, drive and determination for excellence of execution. This position would work closely with internal and external stakeholders to bring the innovation pipeline to life. This role reports to the VP of Innovation and based out of the West Loop office.  What you will be responsible for: Develop and validate concepts supported by strategic category and consumer insights that deliver on key consumer needs and align to the brand. Work closely with a diverse, cross-functional team to help shepherd innovation propositions through the innovation process, considering consumer and brand needs. Own an inspiring marketing launch strategy which will support new project launches for an extended period of time. \xa0 Closely collaborate with the Brand and Creative team to ensure the marketing launch strategy is executed Construct and manage the innovation metrics (post launch) that support overall growth and profitability Manage a robust pipeline of disruptive innovation that drives incremental and profitable growth.  Who you are: Bachelor's degree (minimum), MBA preferred, in Marketing or related discipline 2-5 years experience preferred in marketing or related field of work Minimum 2 years marketing experience focused on innovation Experience in developing innovation design briefs, naming, positioning and marketing launch strategies Demonstrated strategic and financial acumen Interpersonal communication skills, written and verbal communication, organizational skills, project management skills must all be strong. Prior CPG experience Must be capable of working in a fast-paced, team environment with minimal direct supervision and the ability to adhere to aggressive deadlines Ability to manage across multiple projects"]

["Company DescriptionMerkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices. For more than 30 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. The agency's heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive people-based marketing strategies. Its combined strengths in performance media, customer experience, customer relationship management, loyalty, and enterprise marketing technology drive improved marketing results and competitive advantage. With 5,500 employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, with 24 additional offices in the US and 25 offices in Europe and APAC. In 2016, the agency joined the Dentsu Aegis Network.Job DescriptionThe Customer Strategy Director will join a team of talented and experienced strategists in Merkle’s Customer Strategy Team. The Director will strive to obtain a deep understanding of our client’s business, strategic objectives, and be able to build strong client relationships that will enable them to become a trusted advisor to the client and a Merkle Account Team Leadership. Directors are also expected to support new business opportunities within the Customer Strategy Group. Advanced CRM and database marketing expertise is required, combined with demonstrated experience in planning, developing and managing omni-channel campaigns that generate measurable ROI.Key ResponsibilitiesSupport senior strategy team in the building, development, and delivery of strategic/complex omni-channel, acquisition plans ensuring that recommendations are in line with best practices and exhibit thought leadership.Act as an addressable marketing subject matter expert, particularly in B2C Customer Acquisition and Cross Sell – with demonstrated ability to connect audience strategy with media execution; including direct mail, email, and digital media. Write detailed annual marketing and tactical campaign plans.Provide input into consumer messaging and creative strategy.Develop accurate financial business cases and proformas for each campaign.Review results of marketing campaigns, provides insights and recommendations to improve performance.Support senior strategy team with quarterly executive business reviews, highlighting performance results and identifying growth opportunities and plans.Monitor current omnichannel trends and competitive strategies – and then translate them into new marketing ideas for clients. Develop trusted, long-term relationships with key client contacts through the presentation of strategic ideas and thought leadership.Ensure meaningful client value is delivered to retain and grow client relationships through a strong mix of best-practice solutions, skills, and capabilities while meeting client KPIs and generating measurable results.Collaborate and develop relationships with internal Merkle teams (account management, operations, creative, analytics etc.), and client partner agencies to define and implement capabilities in support of cross-channel recommendations/ plans. QualificationsBachelor’s Degree (required), Master’s Degree (preferred).8+ years deep experience in omni-channel marketing (direct mail, email, and digital) with 3-5 of those years working in a similar capacity within an agency or consulting firm.Experience in bank and credit card marketing, strongly preferred.B2C acquisition and cross sell experience with a proven ability to translate data analysis into actionable marketing recommendations, projections, and KPIs – requires strong database marketing and analysis skills, as well as advanced proficiency in Excel.Hands-on skills using data and research to drive decisions.Strong writing, presentation and client facing communication skills (strong proficiency in PowerPoint is required).Ardent attention to detail and the ability to incorporate internal and external feedback on an iterative basis.Ability to leverage business experience and competitive research, combined with the client’s value proposition, to identify new business and marketing opportunities.Strong listening skills to understand clients visible and invisible needs, can recognize a situation needing a resolution.Must have superior multi-tasking, networking, time management and inter-personal skills.Self-starter, independently pursues account growth opportunities. High intellectual curiosity, drive, determination, self-confidence and persuasion skills.Comfort and experience working within a highly matrixed organization in roles with a wide degree of latitude.25% travel required, varies with client planning timeframes.Location: Chicago, Columbia (MD), New York, Pittsburgh, Remote Considered (Eastern US)Additional InformationAt Merkle, we believe that a diverse environment improves us as a community and as a business. We want to foster an environment of growth, where all ideas and contributions are encouraged. We need this culture of courage to continue to thrive in our fast-paced industry. We embrace differences of opinion. We value diversity of experience and thought, which help us to challenge and define industry-leading solutions, and support our goal of being a great place to work."]

Job Title: Brand Marketing: Marketing & Promotional Retail Sales

Need strong ability to set priorities, solve problems, and be resourceful under pressure.Experience working with agency/client partners, exhibiting the ability to generate maximum return through effective marketing strategies and direction.For IMMEDIATE consideration APPLY NOW!!"]
